result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Yolanda Renee Cooper-Bledsoe

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Yolanda Renee Cooper-Bledsoe appeared by video.  Attorney Seelow for Megan Kaldunski in court for Yolanda Renee Cooper-Bledsoe.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 10.
Review hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
At the request of the parties, the status hearing set for 8-30-22 at 8:30 am is converted to a Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing.
Early Intervention Program child Protective Advocacy Deferred Prosecution Agreement, filed.

Defendant Yolanda Renee Cooper-Bledsoe in court with attorney Megan Kaldunski.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.  Court started with the plea hearing and during the hearing ended the hearing and ordered the case adjourned to a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 8-30-22 at 8:30 am for status conference.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Early Intervention Program Child Protective Advocacy Deferred Prosecution Agreement, filed.

Defendant Yolanda Renee Cooper-Bledsoe in court with attorney Megan Kaldunski.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Yolanda Renee Cooper-Bledsoe appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense motion as to no contact order.  Arguments heard.  Court will amend no contact order to allow contact only in the presence of a family therapist.  Defense counsel requests DPA Hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Defendant's motion to modify conditions of bond

Defendant Yolanda Renee Cooper-Bledsoe in court with attorney Megan Kaldunski.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Yolanda Renee Cooper-Bledsoe appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Michael Weiland. Milwaukee Police Department Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Yolanda Renee Cooper-Bledsoe in court with attorney Megan Kaldunski.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Attorney Kaldunski was just appointed to the case.  Case needs a preliminary hearing. Case is adjourned to 4-25-22 at 1:30 pm for Preliminary Hearing in Br. 10 by zoom.
  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Yolanda Renee Cooper-Bledsoe in court.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Yolanda Renee Cooper-Bledsoe appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  State's witness present by zoom.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel as this time.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with LC, CB, LB
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LC, CB, or LB.

ADDRESS INFO for Yolanda Renee Cooper-Bledsoe
Current: 1946A South 7th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 03-19-2022)
Prior: 1946 South 7th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Defendant Yolanda Renee Cooper-Bledsoe in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Yolanda Renee Cooper-Bledsoe in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Yolanda Renee Cooper-Bledsoe appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
